intro: Halimolobos berlandieri, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its gray-green, hairy foliage and showy, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. Halimolobos berlandieri plays a role in supporting local pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
